newsitem.title: IRAQ: Iraq condems Ethiopia for "aggression" on Sudan.
newsitem.headline: Iraq condems Ethiopia for "aggression" on Sudan.

text.p: Iraq threw its diplomatic support behind Sudan on Thursday, condemning Ethiopia for allegedly attacking two Sudanese towns and supporting a rebel alliance.

"Iraq condemns the recent Ethiopian aggression on brotherly Sudan which threatens its stability, security and territorial integrity," official Iraqi newspapers said, quoting an Iraqi foreign ministry spokesman.
He accused Ethiopia of invading two Sudanese towns and backing rebels in the south.
Ethiopia has denied Sudanese allegations its forces had invaded from across the border. Sudanese rebels allied to Ethiopia have claimed responsibility for the attacks.
The Iraqi spokesman urged Arab countries and the Arab League to stand with Sudan in "defending its sovereignty and unity".
Iraq and Sudan maintain close relations. Khartoum's Islamist military government was supportive of Baghdad during the 1991 Gulf War which drove Iraqi troops out of Kuwait.
